intro: Lepidium hirtum var. psilopterum, commonly known as the slender peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has small, green, ovate leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. The fruit is a short, cylindrical silique that contains several seeds.
